thread.title: The Latest: Kardashians show support for Lamar Odom online
thread.title_full: The Latest: Kardashians show support for Lamar Odom online

title: The Latest: Kardashians show support for Lamar Odom online
text:
Updated: 2:51 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Posted: 2:51 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 The Latest: Kardashians show support for Lamar Odom online Related View Larger FILE - In this April 24, 2007, file photo, Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom sits on the bench in the fourth quarter of a Western Conference playoff basketball game against the Phoenix Suns in Phoenix. Odom, who was embraced by teammates and television fans alike for his Everyman approach to fame, was found face-down and alone Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, after spending four days at the Love Ranch, a legal Nevada brothel. (AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin, File) View Larger Richard Hunter, media director for Dennis Hof, who owns the Love Ranch, talks, Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 in Crystal, Nev., about how he found former NBA basketball player Lamar Odom unconscious the day before. Odom, the NBA star and reality TV personality embraced by teammates and fans for his humble approach to fame, was on life support Wednesday, his estranged wife Khloe Kardashian by his side. Odom was found unresponsive after four days at the brothel. (AP Photo/Chris Carlson) View Larger FILE - In this June 30, 1999, file photo, Lamar Odom smiles after being selected fourth by the Los Angeles Clippers in the first round of the NBA Draft at the MCI Center in Washington. Odom spent most of his 14-year NBA career in Los Angeles with the Lakers and Clippers, becoming a fan favorite before he sought even more fame with the Kardashians. Odom, who was embraced by teammates and television fans alike for his Everyman approach to fame, was found face-down and alone Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, after spending four days at the Love Ranch, a legal Nevada brothel. (AP Photo/Khue Bui, File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press LAS VEGAS â€” 
The latest on the hospitalization of Lamar Odom, who was found unconscious Tuesday in a Nevada brothel (all times local): 
11:45 a.m. 
The Kardashians are showing their support for Lamar Odom on social media. 
Kourtney Kardashian on Thursday tweeted a photo of the former NBA star and fellow reality TV personality with her son, Mason. She wrote: "Believing in the power of prayer for this beautiful soul." 
Her younger sister Kylie Jenner shared an image of herself with Odom on Instagram. The caption read: "Let's dance again together soon. Prayers up for Lamar please." 
Kris Jenner and Rob Kardashian also posted pictures and asked for prayers on the photo-sharing site. 
Khloe Kardashian is with her estranged husband at a Las Vegas hospital, where he remains after being found unconscious Tuesday at a Crystal, Nevada, brothel. There's been no official word on Odom's condition, but the Rev. Jesse Jackson visited him Wednesday and said he's on life support. 
Odom's grandmother Florence Odom and his father, Joe Odom, declined to discuss his condition Thursday. 
___ 
10:30 a.m. 
Khloe Kardashian and the owner of the Love Ranch are sparring over the media frenzy surrounding Lamar Odom, who is hospitalized after being found unconscious at the Nevada brothel. 
Both sides say Kardashian's reps reached out to brothel owner Dennis Hof on Wednesday, asking him not to speak to the press. 
Hof says he's troubled by the lack of communication from Kardashian. He says he angrily dismissed their request that she do interviews instead of him. 
"I know what happened," Hof said. "I'm the one protecting my business and telling the truth about it." 
Kardashian's rep says they politely asked Hoff to respect their privacy. 
Odom remains hospitalized in Las Vegas after being found unconscious Tuesday at the Crystal, Nevada, brothel. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
